properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-awaiting-jobs-request-size
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of carbon aware jobs to update from awaiting to scheduled state per database round-trip.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.api-client-connect-timeout
properties.description: Sets the connect timeout for the API client.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.api-client-read-timeout
properties.description: Sets the read timeout for the API client.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.area-code
properties.description: Sets the areaCode of your datacenter (the area where your application is hosted) in order to have more accurate carbon emissions forecasts. Cannot be used together with externalCode or externalIdentifier.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.data-provider
properties.description: Sets your preferred carbon intensity forecast dataProvider.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.enabled
properties.description: Enables carbon aware scheduling.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.external-code
properties.description: Sets the code of an area as defined by your specified dataProvider in order to have more accurate carbon emissions forecasts. Cannot be used together with areaCode or externalIdentifier and without dataProvider.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.external-identifier
properties.description: Sets the identifier of an area as defined by your specified dataProvider in order to have more accurate carbon emissions forecasts. Cannot be used together with areaCode or externalCode and without dataProvider.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.carbon-aware-job-processing.poll-interval-in-minutes
properties.description: Set the carbonAwareJobProcessingPollIntervalInMinutes for the BackgroundJobServer to see whether pending carbon aware jobs need to be scheduled

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.delete-succeeded-jobs-after
properties.description: Sets the duration to wait before changing jobs that are in the SUCCEEDED state to the DELETED state. If a duration suffix is not specified, hours will be used.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.enabled
properties.description: Enables the background processing of jobs.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.interrupt-jobs-await-duration-on-stop
properties.description: Sets the duration to wait before interrupting threads/jobs when the server is stopped. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.metrics.enabled
properties.description: Configures whether metrics are reported to MicroMeter.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.name
properties.description: Allows to set the name of the {@link org.jobrunr.server.BackgroundJobServer} (used in the dashboard).

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.orphaned-jobs-request-size
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of orphaned jobs to fetch and update per database round-trip (to retry them).

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.permanently-delete-deleted-jobs-after
properties.description: Sets the duration to wait before permanently deleting jobs that are in the DELETED state. If a duration suffix is not specified, hours will be used.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.poll-interval-in-seconds
properties.description: Set the pollIntervalInSeconds for the BackgroundJobServer to see whether new jobs need to be processed

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.scheduled-jobs-request-size
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of jobs to update from scheduled to enqueued state per database round-trip.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.server-timeout-poll-interval-multiplicand
properties.description: Set the pollInterval multiplicand used to determine when a BackgroundJobServer has timed out and processing jobs are orphaned.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.succeeded-jobs-request-size
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of jobs to update from succeeded to deleted state per database round-trip.

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.thread-type
properties.description: Sets the Thread Type for the BackgroundJobServer. By default, this will be determined by the Java version (VirtualThreads as of Java 21).

properties.name: jobrunr.background-job-server.worker-count
properties.description: Sets the workerCount for the BackgroundJobServer which defines the maximum number of jobs that will be run in parallel. By default, this will be determined by the amount of available processor.

properties.name: jobrunr.dashboard.enabled
properties.description: Enables the JobRunr dashboard.

properties.name: jobrunr.dashboard.password
properties.description: The password for the basic authentication which protects the dashboard. WARNING: this is insecure as it is in clear text

properties.name: jobrunr.dashboard.port
properties.description: The port on which the Dashboard should run

properties.name: jobrunr.dashboard.username
properties.description: The username for the basic authentication which protects the dashboard

properties.name: jobrunr.database.database-name
properties.description: The name of the database to use (only used by MongoDBStorageProvider). By default, it is 'jobrunr'.

properties.name: jobrunr.database.datasource
properties.description: An optional named {@link javax.sql.DataSource} to use. Defaults to the 'default' datasource.

properties.name: jobrunr.database.skip-create
properties.description: Allows to skip the creation of the tables - this means you should add them manually or by database migration tools like FlywayDB.

properties.name: jobrunr.database.table-prefix
properties.description: Allows to set the table prefix used by JobRunr

properties.name: jobrunr.database.type
properties.description: If multiple types of databases are available in the Spring Context (e.g. a DataSource and an MongoDB Client), this setting allows to specify the type of database for JobRunr to use. Valid values are 'sql', 'mongodb' and 'mem'.

properties.name: jobrunr.job-scheduler.enabled
properties.description: Enables the scheduling of jobs.

properties.name: jobrunr.job-scheduler.job-details-generator
properties.description: Defines the JobDetailsGenerator to use. This should be the fully qualified classname of the JobDetailsGenerator, and it should have a default no-argument constructor.

properties.name: jobrunr.jobs.default-number-of-retries
properties.description: Configures the default amount of retries.

properties.name: jobrunr.jobs.metrics.enabled
properties.description: Configures whether metrics are reported to MicroMeter.

properties.name: jobrunr.miscellaneous.allow-anonymous-data-usage
properties.description: Allows to opt-out of anonymous usage statistics. This setting is true by default and sends only the total amount of succeeded jobs processed by your cluster per day to show a counter on the JobRunr website for marketing purposes.
